required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Sensor Off Study Using a Nellcor USB Pulse Oximetry Monitor Interface Cable
clinical_study.official_title: Sensor Off Study Using a Nellcor USB Pulse Oximetry Monitor Interface Cable

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to validate that the device posts a Sensor-Off message within the time frame stated in the proposed claims.

primary_outcome.measure: Report the Time Until the Device Posts "Sensor Off" After the Sensor is Removed
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 minute per event, multiple events per subject. Total duration up to 1 hour
primary_outcome.description: A series of sensor-off events were collected from subjects in the study using marketed, off-the-shelf sensors. Each event was marked as pass if event duration (Timeend - Timestart) was less than or equal to 60 seconds; otherwise, the event was marked as greater than or equal to 60 seconds. The acceptance criteria is if 90% of the time the product posts Sensor Off, or any equal or higher priority alarm, within 60 seconds after sensor is removed.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Nellcor USB Pulse Oximeter Monitor Interface Cable Sensor Test

intervention.intervention_name: Nellcor USB Pulse Oximeter Monitor Interface Cable
intervention.description: Volunteers are subjected to certain simulated, sensor removal conditions known to represent challenges to the sensor-off feature. Such conditions include exposing the sensor to an ambient light source, sensor slipping off the finger with the light emitter and detector facing each other or a sensor slipping off under a blanket.
intervention.arm_group_label: Nellcor USB Pulse Oximeter Monitor Interface Cable Sensor Test

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female subjects 18 or older (inclusive)
- Subject is able to participate for the duration of the study
- Subject is willing to sign an informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous injury or trauma to fingers or hands that may change blood flow or vascular supply and affect our ability to test sensors
- Physiologic abnormalities that prevent proper application of pulse oximetry sensor
- Severe contact allergies that cause a reaction to standard adhesive materials such as those found in medical sensors and electrodes

patient_data.ipd_description: The data will not be shared.

group.title: The Oxicable Pulse Oximetry Device
group.description: The subjects sit in a chair while a pulse oximetry sensor, hooked to the Oxicable pulse oximeter and a data collection system, is placed and removed in a certain sequence. This is done to demonstrate that the sensor-off feature displays per specifications when subjected to certain simulated, sensor removal conditions known to represent challenges to the sensor-off feature.

participants_list.participants: All subjects completed, one excluded from the analysis due to an issue with the data collection

group.title: The Oxicable Pulse Oximetry Device
group.description: The subjects sit in a chair while a pulse oximetry sensor, hooked to the Oxicable pulse oximeter and a data collection system, is placed and removed in a certain sequence. category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Report the Time Until the Device Posts "Sensor Off" After the Sensor is Removed
outcome.description: A series of sensor-off events were collected from subjects in the study using marketed, off-the-shelf sensors. Each event was marked as pass if event duration (Timeend – Timestart) was less than or equal to 60 seconds; otherwise, the event was marked as greater than or equal to 60 seconds. The acceptance criteria is if 90% of the time the product posts Sensor Off, or any equal or higher priority alarm, within 60 seconds after sensor is removed.
outcome.time_frame: 1 minute per event, multiple events per subject. Total duration up to 1 hour
outcome.population: 20 subjects participated. There were errors with the data collection device for one subject and the data was unusable.

This is done to demonstrate that the sensor-off feature displays per specifications when subjected to certain simulated, sensor removal conditions known to represent challenges to the sensor-off feature.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
